page.title: 06HOUSING Essex/Cambs Border
page.content: There is a wide variety of housing in this area. About 50% of the popula- tion were born in immediate locality. Delapidated farm cottages are being purchased by people outside the area to modernise and extend - popular as communications and employment are good. These included a row of flint semi-detached cottages, 3 brick terraces and 2 thatched timber-framed cottages. About 30% of population live in Local Authority semi-detached houses or bungalows in Crawley End, Chrishall. Some locals have taken the opportunity of buying their own Local Authority houses. With strict plann- ing controls only 2 houses have been built within the last 10 years. Three large farmhouses are still the centre of a farm living - one is not.
